text: Music what up outliers quick Market Outlook for the week ahead we had a bit of an interesting week last week we obviously saw the FED cut rates there's a lot of speculation now what that means for the markets going forward there's people like myself that are still kind of not convinced that we're in the the land of soft Landing there are other people that think we've nailed it and we're good only time will tell so I just want to take a quick look of the market what's coming up this week and that will essentially hopefully set us all up for a solid week because there's a couple things so first off I still am seeing obviously relative strength within large caps the other thing I'm seeing is that even the qes are starting to Rally they're still like 20 points off off of highs and then if we take a look at small caps small caps have now taken down to seven points off of highs so what that tells me is Tech still is not really that strong and then that tells me when I'm looking at the performance of the SP 500 it's not it's not primarily coming from technology it's coming from these other sectors it's coming from xlu it's coming from XLF which is now just back up essentially at alltime highs we'll see how that goes it's coming from xlc it's coming from xlb it's coming from xli I so

text: not it's not primarily coming from technology it's coming from these other sectors it's coming from xlu it's coming from XLF which is now just back up essentially at alltime highs we'll see how that goes it's coming from xlc it's coming from xlb it's coming from xli I so this is one of those really interesting scenarios where for so long technology was really dragging everything up with it and it's kind of the inverse it's the rest of the sector or the rest of the index via all these different sectors is what's really dragging spy up it's not being fueled by Tech and again this is just not super common so when I'm looking for opportunities it's really interesting I'm still finding a lot of really interesting things in utility for sure and which I don't think most people thought that that's where we would be looking right now but that is where we're still continuing to see some level of strength the other thing is looking at a market perspective this coming week we have a few things coming up so when I look at the 23rd main thing are going to be services in manufacturing PMI then the 24th consumer confidence I'm actually not that jazzed about it meaning I don't think it's going to be a big deal but I do think it's going to be an important read Because what I can tell you right now is if we take a look at

text: PMI then the 24th consumer confidence I'm actually not that jazzed about it meaning I don't think it's going to be a big deal but I do think it's going to be an important read Because what I can tell you right now is if we take a look at Fred there are few things going on so the first thing is if we take a look at delinquency rates I can see a few very clear Trends the first one is delinquency rates on credit cards are still going up I can also see that consumer loan charge offs is also going up so I don't like seeing all these different debt instruments from a consumer perspective increasing and I also can see that personal savings is actually Contracting which I don't love so a big part of this is understanding you know what the new Norm is what the new paradigm is but what I can tell you is it's not like the consumer is in this fantastic position now I still fully expect to see things in like real estate showing strength because as rates come down the real estate market is likely going to become a little bit more active but I'm not sure that the consumer is in this Rock Solid position and again there's leads and lags to this whole thing so it can take a little while before we see the consumer starting to struggle holistically then if we look at the 25th
